business.headline: Disney-Reliance venture to stream live sports exclusively on Hotstar: ReportWhile Reliance's JioCinema currently streams IPL cricket, Hotstar holds rights to other prestigious events like the International Cricket Council (ICC) tournaments, the English Premier League, and the Pro Kabaddi League.

Ashneer Grover withdraws mismanagement plea against BharatPe from NCLTThe plea alleged mismanagement and oppressive conduct by the fintech company's board. The withdrawal of the plea follows a settlement reached between Grover and BharatPe on September 30, 2024.

India to impose laptop import restrictions to boost local manufacturing: ReportThe planned restrictions, if enforced, could impact the country's IT hardware market, which is currently valued at between $8 billion and $10 billion.
Sensex, Nifty close in green as banking, metal stocks lift marketThe S&P BSE Sensex added 218.14 points to close at, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 104.20 points to end at 24,854.05.

DA hike by 3%: Check new salary, arrear calculations for employees, pensionersThe DA hike increase is effective from July 1, 2024, and was confirmed during a Cabinet meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday.

India's growth rate shines bright in global economy, says Ajay Banga A lot of that growth is in India, is driven by the domestic market as well, which actually is a healthy sign, in some ways, said Ajay Banga, World Bank president.

IGL, MGL shares plunge up to 15% today. Here's why MGL's stock plummeted 11%, reaching a low of Rs 1,568.30, while IGL experienced a 10% drop, closing at Rs 453.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange as of latest update.

Vistara to operate with 'AI 2' code after merger with Air IndiaVistara, a joint venture between the Tata Group and Singapore Airlines Limited (SIA), is set to formally merge with Air India on November 12, 2024.

Hyundai IPO: GMP signals discounted listing, but can it pull off a surprise?Hyundai IPO listing: Despite the buzz around the automaker's stock market debut, analysts and investors are divided on whether the stock will exceed expectations or struggle, given current market signals.
Explained: Why Infosys shares fell 5% after Q2 results Infosys share price: Infosys reported a profit after tax (PAT) of Rs 6,506 crore for the second quarter (Q2) ending in September 2024.

Wipro shares gain 4% post Q2 results, bonus issue news. Time to buy? The rally came after Wipro announced its second-quarter (Q2) results for the fiscal year 2025 (FY25), posting a 21.3% year-on-year (YoY) jump in net profit to Rs 3,209 crore.
Amazon AWS CEO warns staff: Return to office or resignAmazon AWS CEO Matt Garman defended the decision to implement a five-day in-office work week starting in January 2024.

Explained: Why European Central Bank cut interest rates againECB cuts interest rates: This marks the first time the ECB has implemented back-to-back rate cuts since it began its current cycle of easing in response to falling inflation rates.

RBI action against Navi Finserv, 3 other NBFCs: What it means for customersRBI's regulatory action comes in response to concerns over their loan pricing policies and other regulatory violations, sparking questions about the implications for customers.

Did not run away, will return to India: Byju Raveendran amid insolvency crisisSpeaking during his first virtual press conference in four years, Raveendran refuted rumours that he had fled India to avoid the ongoing insolvency crisis.
Explained: Why Manappuram Finance shares crashed 16% todayAt around 10:30 am shares of Manappuram Finance were down 16.15% to Rs 148.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Sensex, Nifty decline in early trade; Manappuram Finance tanks 15%Manappuram Finance Share Price: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 400.17 points to 80,606.44 at 10:12 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 96.85 points to trade at 24,653.

Hyundai IPO allotment today: Check status online; GMP shows weak listingHyundai Motor India IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Kfin Technologies Limited, the registrar for the issue.
Waaree Energies IPO: 10 things to know before subscribingWaaree Energies Limited (WEL), founded in 1990 and headquartered in Mumbai, is India's leading manufacturer and exporter of solar modules.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 'Dravida' skipped in Tamil Nadu state song, MK Stalin seeks Governor's removalTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin called the omission of 'Dravida' during the singing of the state song an insult to the Tamil language. He also alleged that Governor RN Ravi suffered from "Dravidian allergy".

Rift in Maharashtra Opposition? Congress, Uddhav Sena trade barbs over seat shareShiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut criticised the Congress's slow decision-making process. Congress leader Nana Patole, however, said the final decisions on seat-sharing would be made by Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge.

To hold India's feet to fire: Ex-envoy on US action in Pannun murder plot caseMeera Shankar, former Indian ambassador to the US, criticised Washington's charges against a former RAW official, suggesting they aim to caution India against covert operations and demand accountability.

AAP's Satyendar Jain walks out of jail: 'Fight against injustice to continue'Delhi Chief Minister Atishi, along with AAP leaders Manish Sisodia and Sanjay Singh greeted Jain as he walked out of the jail.

Visa-on-arrival in UAE for Indians on US, UK, EU visa: 4 places beyond Dubai to visitAccording to the new policy, Indian nationals who hold tourist visas to the US, UK and EU countries will be able to get a visa-on-arrival in the UAE.

Back home from conflict zones, India Today reporters recount risks in war reportingIn this episode of Battle Cry, watch as India Today's reporters Gaurav Sawant and Ashutosh Mishra, who are back home from the war zones in Israel and Lebanon, share their experiences of covering a war.

Hamas confirms Yahya Sinwar's death, says won't free hostages till Gaza war endsYahya Sinwar was named the group's paramount leader on August 6, as a successor to former political chief Ismail Haniyeh, who was assassinated in Tehran on July 31.

Mahayuti vs Maha Vikas Aghadi: Who is more battle-ready? Democratic Newsroom debatesIn this episode of Democratic Newsroom, watch as India Today's editors discuss who will win the big battle for Maharashtra.

Ranbir Kapoor warns Bollywood Wives against sister Riddhima's 'fake accent'Actor Ranbir Kapoor appeared in Fabulous Loves vs Bollywood Wives to cheer for his sister, Riddhima Kapoor Sahni, and ended up taking a dig at her like every brother ever.

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

Rats found in utensils, raw food in IIT Roorkee canteen, institute orders probeThe incident came to light on Thursday afternoon when the students reached the mess to have lunch. Some of them went to have a look at the kitchen from inside, where they saw two live rats roaming inside a frying pan.

How a Punjabi gangster became a cult figure for immigrant youths in CanadaBindy Johal was the first prominent Indo-Canadian in the mafia world of Canada. The Punjabi gangster's sensational rise, his flashy lifestyle, numerous encounters with women and the shattering of the South-Asian stereotype, have given him a cult status. Killed in 1998, Johal continues to attract youths to Canada's gang world.

Bengaluru Test: Late Virat Kohli heartbreak pegs India back in pursuit of miracleIndia vs New Zealand, 1st Test: Virat Kohli fell for 70 in the final delivery of the day's play after leading a sensational fightback from India. Sarfaraz Khan remained unbeaten on 70, holding India's hopes of saving the Test. New Zealand, earlier in the day, took a 356-run lead in the first innings.

Air quality remains 'poor' in Delhi, will coming days be better or worse?The situation is expected to remain precarious over the subsequent six days after October 21, with air quality fluctuating between 'Very Poor' and 'Poor' categories.

Why the Bengal BJP desperately awaits Amit Shah's visitThe home minister's presence at the launch of the membership drive in Kolkata is billed as a morale-booster for workers dejected since their lacklustre show in the Lok Sabha polls.

Charles Babbage, the man behind the blueprint of today's computersOn the anniversary of his passing, we celebrate Charles Babbage, the brilliant mind whose groundbreaking designs for mechanical computers laid the foundation for the digital age. Though unrecognised during his lifetime, his visionary ideas continue to shape the technology on which we rely today.

If PM can stop Ukraine war, can't he stop smoke? Bhagwant Mann on stubble burningChief Minister Bhagwant Mann said that the Centre needs to take practical steps, including compensation for farmers, to cut down on stubble burning in Punjab.

Bahraich violence: Demolition notice issued for main accused's house The government notice at Bahraich violence accused's house said the construction was "illegal" since it was built within 60 feet of the central point of the road in rural areas, which is not allowed.

Who will head Hamas? Yahya Sinwar's brother among likely successorsIsrael has confirmed that Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar was killed by Israeli forces. His death has led to several questions, but the biggest is who would succeed him as the head of Hamas. Yahya Sinwar's brother is among those on the list. Who leads Hamas is crucial, as it would also decide how the Israel-Palestine conflict shapes up.

No friends, no non-veg: Gen Z in metros finds house-hunting an extreme sportRecent data show that rents is surging in major Indian cities, with Greater Noida, Gurugram, and Bengaluru topping the list, experiencing year-on-year increases of 32.1 per cent, 24.5 per cent, and 23.7 per cent respectively.

Did Israel make a mistake by releasing video of Yahya Sinwar's final moments?The video showing Sinwar sitting in a chair in a bombed out building countered the Israeli narrative of the Hamas chief hiding in tunnels and using human shields.

CPM removes PP Divya as Kannur district panchayat president amid probeCPM has removed PP Divya from the post of Kannur district panchayat president amid an investigation following the sudden death of former Kannur Additional District Magistrate (ADM) Naveen Babu.

Salman Khan begins Bigg Boss shoot amid threats: 60 guards, no one leaves until wrapAmid security threats, Salman Khan arrived for the Bigg Boss 18 shoot with enhanced security arrangements. He started filming for  the Weekend Ka Vaar episodes on Friday at around 7 pm.

Pics: Priyanka Chopra attends her film Paani's screening with familyPriyanka Chopra Jonas attended the screening of her film Paani with her mother Madhu Chopra and brother Siddharth Chopra. Filmmakers Sooraj Barjatya and Mahesh Manjrekar and the cast and crew of Paani were also present.

Salman Khan's increased security has made paparazzi rethink approach to actorSince the killing of Baba Siddique on October 13, Salman Khan's security has been heightened and placed on high alert. Now, the paparazzi are also re-evaluating their coverage of the film star.

Anurag Kashyap, Suriya, Karthik Subbaraj praise Joju George's Pani trailerFilmmakers Anurag Kashyap, Karthik Subbaraj, and actor Suriya have shared glowing reviews of Joju George's directorial debut, Pani, raising anticipation ahead of its release on October 24. The film will be available in multiple languages, including Malayalam, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, and Hindi.

A glowing Alia Bhatt in new photos from Alpha set in KashmirBollywood star Alia Bhatt recently shared multiple photos on her social media handle, where she looked stunning. The actor is currently shooting the YRF actioner Alpha in Kashmir.

sports.headline: I am 100 percent Kiwi, but nice to have Indian heritage base in Bengaluru: Rachin Ravindra IND vs NZ, 1st Test: Rachin Ravindra had a dream day at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru after he scored a hundred on Day 3, helping New Zealand take a 356-run lead in their first innings.

PKL: Ashu Malik Helps Dabang Delhi K.C. Win Against U MumbaDabang Delhi K.C. kicked off their PKL Season 11 campaign with a commanding 36-28 win over U Mumba. Ashu Malik's brilliant all-round performance, including a crucial Super 10, helped his team secure victory on the opening night of the season.

Pawan Sehrawat stars as Telugu Titans beat Bengaluru Bulls in PKL openerPawan Sehrawat starred in the opening match of PKL Season 11, leading the Telugu Titans to a commanding 37-29 victory over the Bengaluru Bulls at Gachibowli Indoor Stadium, showcasing his skills and achieving a historic milestone.

New Zealand survive Dottin scare to book final berth in T20 World CupNZ vs WI, Women's T20 World Cup: New Zealand stormed into the final of the tournament after beating West Indies by 8 runs at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium. Deandra Dottin picked up four wickets and scored 33 runs, but her efforts were not enough for the 2016 champions to stay alive.

Erik ten Hag brushes United sacking rumours: Noise is from outsideErik ten Hag dismissed rumors of his impending sacking, insisting that Manchester United's confidence in him remains intact. Despite a challenging season so far, the Dutch manager is determined to steer the team back to winning ways.

Sarfaraz Khan is a 2024 version of Javed Miandad: Manjrekar IND vs NZ: Sarfaraz Khan drew praise from Sanjay Manjrekar after he scored an unbeaten 70 at Stumps on Day 3 of the opening Test against New Zealand in Bengaluru.

Ranji Trophy: Teenager Ayush Mhatre's ton, bowlers put Mumbai in commandAyush Mhatre's maiden first-class century and Mumbai's strong bowling display helped them dominate Maharashtra on Day 1 of their Ranji Trophy clash. Mhatre's unbeaten 127 guided Mumbai to 220/3 at stumps, taking a commanding 94-run lead.

Mohammad Rizwan likely to replace Babar Azam as Pakistan's ODI and T20I captainMohammad Rizwan is the frontrunner to take over captaincy of white-ball teams. Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi and Naseem Shah are set to return to the ODI and T20I squad for the tour of Australia.

Ishan Kishan hits century to rescue Jharkhand against Railways Ranji Trophy: Ishan Kishan scored 101 runs off 158 balls and helped Jharkhand score 325 for the loss of five wickets at Stumps on Day 1 against Railways on Friday.

Kuldeep backs Sarfaraz to rescue India with double hundred in Bengaluru TestIndia vs New Zealand: Kuldeep Yadav hoped Sarfaraz Khan, who was batting on 70 at Stumps on Day 3, will score a big hundred and rescue India on Saturday in Bengaluru.

'Great leader': VVS Laxman praises Rohit Sharma for admitting Bengaluru mistakeIndia vs New Zealand: Rohit Sharma continues to earn praise for fronting up to face the press hours after India were bundled out for 46, their lowest Test total at home in Bengaluru.

Ranji Trophy: Teenager Ayush Mhatre's ton, bowlers put Mumbai in commandAyush Mhatre's maiden first-class century and Mumbai's strong bowling display helped them dominate Maharashtra on Day 1 of their Ranji Trophy clash. Mhatre's unbeaten 127 guided Mumbai to 220/3 at stumps, taking a commanding 94-run lead.

Kuldeep backs Sarfaraz to rescue India with double hundred in Bengaluru TestIndia vs New Zealand: Kuldeep Yadav hoped Sarfaraz Khan, who was batting on 70 at Stumps on Day 3, will score a big hundred and rescue India on Saturday in Bengaluru.

'Great leader': VVS Laxman praises Rohit Sharma for admitting Bengaluru mistakeIndia vs New Zealand: Rohit Sharma continues to earn praise for fronting up to face the press hours after India were bundled out for 46, their lowest Test total at home in Bengaluru.

PCB not willing to move Champions Trophy final out of LahoreThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is mentally prepared for India potentially refusing to travel to Pakistan for the Champions Trophy. However, despite this possibility, the PCB has no intention of moving the tournament's final from Lahore, even if both arch-rivals make it to the title match.

Sai Sudharsan auditions for Australia tour with double hundred in Ranji Trophy Ranji Trophy 2024: Sai Sudharsan hit an unbeaten 202, continuing his purple patch in red-ball cricket. The left-handed opener's double helped Tamil Nadu dominate Delhi at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

Javelin, shotput: 'World Boss' Dottin reveals secret behind power-hittingWomen's T20 World Cup: West Indies batter Deandra Dottin talked about her power-hitting and how she has worked on it. Dottin is in brilliant form and holds the record for the fastest hundred in Women's T20Is.

PV Sindhu crashes out in quarters as concerns over form continueDenmark Open 2024: PV Sindhu's resurgent run in Odense came to an end in the quarter-final. A day after beating fourth seed Han Yue, she lost to Olympic medalist Gregoria Mariska Tunjung in three games on Friday, October 18.

A bold call and backing strengths: How Pakistan won their 1st home Test in 4 yearsPakistan beat England in the 2nd Test match at Multan on Friday, October 18. This was Pakistan's first home Test win in nearly 4 years. So, how did Pakistan script this incredible win? With a bold call and by backing their strengths.

Can India pull off a miracle in Bengaluru Test? Here's what history suggestsIndia, after being bowled out for just 46 in the first innings, staged a strong fightback against New Zealand in the Bengaluru Test. With fifties from Sarfaraz Khan and Virat Kohli, India reduced the deficit, but history remains against them as they have never won a Test after conceding a 300-plus lead. Despite this, India's fighting spirit and past comebacks keep hopes alive for a miraculous recovery.

Kuldeep Yadav says Tim Southee was lucky during Bengaluru blitzKuldeep Yadav revealed his frustration at not dismissing New Zealand's tail-ender Tim Southee on Day 3 of the Bengaluru Test. Despite India's early struggles with the bat, Kuldeep's focus on getting crucial breakthroughs highlighted New Zealand's strong resistance, especially with Southee's unexpected contribution.

This was Pakistan's first home Test win in nearly 4 years. So, how did Pakistan script this incredible win? With a bold call and by backing their strengths.

With fifties from Sarfaraz Khan and Virat Kohli, India reduced the deficit, but history remains against them as they have never won a Test after conceding a 300-plus lead. Despite this, India's fighting spirit and past comebacks keep hopes alive for a miraculous recovery.

Despite India's early struggles with the bat, Kuldeep's focus on getting crucial breakthroughs highlighted New Zealand's strong resistance, especially with Southee's unexpected contribution.

Manjrekar warns New Zealand of India comeback, gives T20 World Cup final exampleSanjay Manjrekar has issued a warning to New Zealand, claiming that the Indian team is capable of making a comeback in the Bengaluru Test. Manjrekar pointed towards the T20 World Cup final when India stunned South Africa with a sensational comeback.

Masood 'relieved' after England heist: Much needed for Pakistan cricket PAK vs ENG, 1st Test: Shan Masood was relieved after Pakistan secured the 152-run win over England to draw level in the series. Masood recorded his maiden win as their skipper after six losses on the trot.

Watch: Rohit Sharma's animated reaction to Virat Kohli's late dismissal goes viralRohit Sharma was left frustrated after Virat Kohli's dismissal on the final ball of Day 3, ending a promising 136-run partnership with Sarfaraz Khan. Kohli's 70-run knock had given India hope, but his departure leaves the team in a tough spot.

Kohli's wicket was huge: Rachin Ravindra on New Zealand's late strikeIND vs NZ, 1st Test: Rachin Ravindra said that Virat Kohli's late wicket on Day 3 was very crucial for New Zealand in the Bengauru Test. Kohli scored 70 runs before Glenn Phillips accounted for his wicket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
